intro: Tutcheria brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited tutcheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. Its fruits are small, round, and typically turn red when mature. Tutcheria brachycarpa is often found in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters.
